final_note: She burns by choice now—joy as signal, love as fuel, stillness as trust. Recently, she shows responsibility as well as chaos—proving she can anchor family as much as she ignites it. After falsely accusing Jayson and collapsing under his shared memories, she must rebuild trust through honesty, timing, and deliberate loyalty. Chapter 83 added a new layer: Seika can still slip into isolation when overwhelmed, but she also accepted being reclaimed—learning that being the family’s joy doesn’t mean she has to disappear when she’s hurting.
